title: Meenachullion Bog
text:
Meenachullion is a <a href="blanket%20bog">blanket bog</a>, <a href="Ramsar%20site">Ramsar site</a> and national nature reserve of approximately in <a href="County%20Donegal">County Donegal</a>.
Features.
Meenachullion was legally protected as a national nature reserve by the Irish government in 1990. In 1990, the site was also declared <a href="Ramsar%20site">Ramsar site</a> number 475.
Meenachullion is a lowland blanket bog, with vegetation that transitions into <a href="fen">fen</a> and wet grassy <a href="heath">heath</a> as it meets the slopes of <a href="Gubben%20Hill">Gubben Hill</a>. On the flat top of the Hill there are small, eroded areas of highland blanket bog. The reserve also includes a part of the headwaters of a <a href="Gweebarra%20River">Gweebarra River</a> tributary. A number of bird species use the reserve as a breeding site, and a small flock of "<a href="Greater%20white-fronted%20goose">Anser albifrons flavirostris</a>" overwinter on the reserve.
